H0.text: A coal furnace heating a house is an example of the use of a renewable energy source, defined as a source that will not run out.

H1.text: A windmill pumping water on a farm is an example of using a renewable energy source that will not run out.

H2.text: A kerosene lamp lighting a room is an example of the use of a renewable energy source.

H3.text: A diesel truck traveling along a road is an example of the use of a renewable energy source, which is a source that will not run out.

A4.text: Wind power is a renewable energy source that is replenished on a human timescale.
